columnLayout.Title: Vertical Chart Layout
columnLayout.description: When multiple charts are drawn, then they will be layed out horizontically or vertically.

label.title: Label
label.description: The name for this data series

order.title: Draw Order
order.description: Determines the draw order of the series. Dataseries with lower numbers are drawn on top of ones with higher numbers.

chartName.title: Chart
chartName.description: If two dataseries have the same ''Chart'' name, they will be drawn in the same chart. Otherwise they will get their own chart. If the name ends with #pivot# then a separat chart will be drawn for each pivoted dataseries.

stack.title: Stack Name
stack.description: To stack series on top of each other give them the same stack name.

barThickness.title: Bar Thickness
barThickness.description: The Thickness of the bar in pixels

backgroundColor.title: Point or Bar Color
backgroundColor.description: The inner color of the bars if you chose Drawing Type ''bar'' or the inner colors of the points if you chose Drawing Type ''line''.

borderWidth.title: Line Width
borderWidth.description: In case of Drawing Type ''bar'' this determines the bar''s border line width.

borderDash.title: Line Dash Style
borderDash.description: Specify dash length and space-between-dashes length like this: [10, 5].

borderRadius.title: Bar Corner Radius
borderRadius.description: Number in pixels for a rounding effect on the bars.

data.title: Data
data.description: The data used to draw this data series.

x.description: If timeseries is checked in the settings, then this should be an ISO String date like 2023-11-04T22:47:52.351152+00:00. But this works with many other formats as well.

pivot.title: Pivot Column
pivot.description: You can specify a column in the input data to autogenerate dataseries for each distinct entry in this column. E.g. if you have a table with columns [city, timestamp, temperature] and specify ''city'' as pivot column, then you will get a line for each city.
